alert.note: Alert for Far Northwest Highlands; Northwest Highlands; Northwest Plateau (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 19 at 4:01PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF WESTERN RIO ARRIBA AND CENTRAL SAN JUAN COUNTIES THROUGH 430 PM MDT... At 401 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over southwestern Farmington, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Farmington, Kirtland, Bloomfield, Aztec, Turley, Ojo Amarillo, NAPI Headquarters, Fruitland, Upper Fruitland and Nenahnezad. This includes the following highways... Highway 550 between Mile Markers 130 and 165. Highway 64 between Mile Markers 35 and 80. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Motorists can expect brief but sudden changes in visibility and ponding of water on highways as storms move through the area.

area.areaDesc: Far Northwest Highlands; Northwest Highlands; Northwest Plateau
